intro: Lepia multiflora, commonly known as the many-flowered lepia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Restionaceae and is characterized by its grass-like appearance with narrow, linear leaves. The plant produces small, clustered inflorescences that bloom in spring, typically in shades of white or pale yellow. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in coastal or sandy habitats. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens, though it requires specific conditions to flourish.
